text: XX .
text_tokenized: XX .

text: Mr. Collins was not left long to the silent contemplation of his successful love ; for Mrs. Bennet , having dawdled about in the vestibule to watch for the end of the conference , no sooner saw Elizabeth open the door and with quick step pass her towards the staircase , than she entered the breakfast - room , and congratulated both him and herself in warm terms on the happy prospect of their nearer connection .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins was not left long to the silent contemplation of his successful love ; for Mrs. Bennet , having dawdled about in the vestibule to watch for the end of the conference , no sooner saw Elizabeth open the door and with quick step pass her towards the staircase , than she entered the breakfast - room , and congratulated both him and herself in warm terms on the happy prospect of their nearer connection .

text: Mr. Collins received and returned these felicitations with equal pleasure , and then proceeded to relate the particulars of their interview , with the result of which he trusted he had every reason to be satisfied , since the refusal which his cousin had steadfastly given him would naturally flow from her bashful modesty and the genuine delicacy of her character .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins received and returned these felicitations with equal pleasure , and then proceeded to relate the particulars of their interview , with the result of which he trusted he had every reason to be satisfied , since the refusal which his cousin had steadfastly given him would naturally flow from her bashful modesty and the genuine delicacy of her character .

text: This information , however , startled Mrs. Bennet : she would have been glad to be equally satisfied that her daughter had meant to encourage him by protesting against his proposals , but she dared not believe it , and could not help saying so .
text_tokenized: This information , however , startled Mrs. Bennet : she would have been glad to be equally satisfied that her daughter had meant to encourage him by protesting against his proposals , but she dared not believe it , and could not help saying so .

text: “ But depend upon it , Mr. Collins , ” she added , “ that Lizzy shall be brought to reason .
text_tokenized: “ But depend upon it , Mr. Collins , ” she added , “ that Lizzy shall be brought to reason .

text: I will speak to her about it myself directly .
text_tokenized: I will speak to her about it myself directly .

text: She is a very headstrong , foolish girl , and does not know her own interest ; but I will _ make _ her know it . ”
text_tokenized: She is a very headstrong , foolish girl , and does not know her own interest ; but I will _ make _ her know it . ”

text: “ Pardon me for interrupting you , madam , ” cried Mr. Collins ; “ but if she is really headstrong and foolish , I know not whether she would altogether be a very desirable wife to a man in my situation , who naturally looks for happiness in the marriage state .
text_tokenized: “ Pardon me for interrupting you , madam , ” cried Mr. Collins ; “ but if she is really headstrong and foolish , I know not whether she would altogether be a very desirable wife to a man in my situation , who naturally looks for happiness in the marriage state .

text: If , therefore , she actually persists in rejecting my suit , perhaps it were better not to force her into accepting me , because , if liable to such defects of temper , she could not contribute much to my felicity . ”
text_tokenized: If , therefore , she actually persists in rejecting my suit , perhaps it were better not to force her into accepting me , because , if liable to such defects of temper , she could not contribute much to my felicity . ”

text: “ Sir , you quite misunderstand me , ” said Mrs. Bennet , alarmed .
text_tokenized: “ Sir , you quite misunderstand me , ” said Mrs. Bennet , alarmed .

text: “ Lizzy is only headstrong in such matters as these .
text_tokenized: “ Lizzy is only headstrong in such matters as these .

text: In everything else she is as good - natured a girl as ever lived .
text_tokenized: In everything else she is as good - natured a girl as ever lived .

text: I will go directly to Mr. Bennet , and we shall very soon settle it with her , I am sure . ” She would not give him time to reply , but hurrying instantly to her husband , called out , as she entered the library,-- “ Oh , Mr. Bennet , you are wanted immediately ; we are all in an uproar . You must come and make Lizzy marry Mr. Collins , for she vows she will not have him ; and if you do not make haste he will change his mind and not have _ her _ . ” Mr. Bennet raised his eyes from his book as she entered , and fixed them on her face with a calm unconcern , which was not in the least altered by her communication . “ I have not the pleasure of understanding you , ” said he , when she had finished her speech .
text_tokenized: I will go directly to Mr. Bennet , and we shall very soon settle it with her , I am sure . ” She would not give him time to reply , but hurrying instantly to her husband , called out , as she entered the library,-- “ Oh , Mr. Bennet , you are wanted immediately ; we are all in an uproar . You must come and make Lizzy marry Mr. Collins , for she vows she will not have him ; and if you do not make haste he will change his mind and not have _ her _ . ” Mr. Bennet raised his eyes from his book as she entered , and fixed them on her face with a calm unconcern , which was not in the least altered by her communication . “ I have not the pleasure of understanding you , ” said he , when she had finished her speech .

text: “ Of what are you talking ? ” “ Of Mr. Collins and Lizzy .

text_tokenized: “ Speak to Lizzy about it yourself .

text: Tell her that you insist upon her marrying him . ”
text_tokenized: Tell her that you insist upon her marrying him . ”

text: Mrs. Bennet rang the bell , and Miss Elizabeth was summoned to the library .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Bennet rang the bell , and Miss Elizabeth was summoned to the library .

text: “ Come here , child , ” cried her father as she appeared .
text_tokenized: “ Come here , child , ” cried her father as she appeared .

text: “ I have sent for you on an affair of importance .
text_tokenized: “ I have sent for you on an affair of importance .

text: I understand that Mr. Collins has made you an offer of marriage .
text_tokenized: I understand that Mr. Collins has made you an offer of marriage .

text: Is it true ? ”
text_tokenized: Is it true ? ”

text: Elizabeth replied that it was .

text: “ Very well -- and this offer of marriage you have refused ? ”
text_tokenized: “ Very well -- and this offer of marriage you have refused ? ”

text: We now come to the point .
text_tokenized: We now come to the point .

text: Your mother insists upon your accepting it .
text_tokenized: Your mother insists upon your accepting it .

text: Is it not so , Mrs. Bennet ?
text_tokenized: Is it not so , Mrs. Bennet ?

text: “ Yes , or I will never see her again . ” “ An unhappy alternative is before you , Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: “ Yes , or I will never see her again . ” “ An unhappy alternative is before you , Elizabeth .

text: From this day you must be a stranger to one of your parents .
text_tokenized: From this day you must be a stranger to one of your parents .

text: Your mother will never see you again if you do _ not _ marry Mr. Collins , and I will never see you again if you _ do _ . ”
text_tokenized: Your mother will never see you again if you do _ not _ marry Mr. Collins , and I will never see you again if you _ do _ . ”

text: Elizabeth could not but smile at such a conclusion of such a beginning ; but Mrs. Bennet , who had persuaded herself that her husband regarded the affair as she wished , was excessively disappointed
text_tokenized: Elizabeth could not but smile at such a conclusion of such a beginning ; but Mrs. Bennet , who had persuaded herself that her husband regarded the affair as she wished , was excessively disappointed

text: You promised me to _ insist _ upon her marrying him . ”
text_tokenized: You promised me to _ insist _ upon her marrying him . ”

text: “ My dear , ” replied her husband , “ I have two small favours to request .
text_tokenized: “ My dear , ” replied her husband , “ I have two small favours to request .

text: First , that you will allow me the free use of my understanding on the present occasion ; and , secondly , of my room .
text_tokenized: First , that you will allow me the free use of my understanding on the present occasion ; and , secondly , of my room .

text: I shall be glad to have the library to myself as soon as may be .
text_tokenized: I shall be glad to have the library to myself as soon as may be .

text: Not yet , however , in spite of her disappointment in her husband , did Mrs. Bennet give up the point .
text_tokenized: Not yet , however , in spite of her disappointment in her husband , did Mrs. Bennet give up the point .

text: She talked to Elizabeth again and again ; coaxed and threatened her by turns .
text_tokenized: She talked to Elizabeth again and again ; coaxed and threatened her by turns .

text: She endeavoured to secure Jane in her interest , but Jane , with all possible mildness , declined interfering ; and
text_tokenized: She endeavoured to secure Jane in her interest , but Jane , with all possible mildness , declined interfering ; and

text: Elizabeth , sometimes with real earnestness , and sometimes with playful gaiety , replied to her attacks .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth , sometimes with real earnestness , and sometimes with playful gaiety , replied to her attacks .

text: Though her manner varied , however , her determination never did .
text_tokenized: Though her manner varied , however , her determination never did .

text: Mr. Collins , meanwhile , was meditating in solitude on what had passed .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins , meanwhile , was meditating in solitude on what had passed .

text: He thought too well of himself to comprehend on what motive his cousin could refuse him ; and though his pride was hurt , he suffered in no other way .
text_tokenized: He thought too well of himself to comprehend on what motive his cousin could refuse him ; and though his pride was hurt , he suffered in no other way .

text: His regard for her was quite imaginary ; and the possibility of her deserving her mother ’s reproach prevented his feeling any regret .
text_tokenized: His regard for her was quite imaginary ; and the possibility of her deserving her mother ’s reproach prevented his feeling any regret .

text: While the family were in this confusion , Charlotte Lucas came to spend the day with them .
text_tokenized: While the family were in this confusion , Charlotte Lucas came to spend the day with them .

text: She was met in the vestibule by Lydia , who , flying to her , cried in a half whisper , “ I am glad you are come , for there is such fun here !
text_tokenized: She was met in the vestibule by Lydia , who , flying to her , cried in a half whisper , “ I am glad you are come , for there is such fun here !

text: What do you think has happened this morning ?
text_tokenized: What do you think has happened this morning ?

text: Mr. Collins has made an offer to Lizzy , and she will not have him .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins has made an offer to Lizzy , and she will not have him .

text: ] Charlotte had hardly time to answer before they were joined by Kitty , who came to tell the same news ; and no sooner had they entered the breakfast - room , where Mrs. Bennet was alone , than she likewise began on the subject , calling on Miss Lucas for her compassion , and entreating her to persuade her friend Lizzy to comply with the wishes of her family .
text_tokenized: ] Charlotte had hardly time to answer before they were joined by Kitty , who came to tell the same news ; and no sooner had they entered the breakfast - room , where Mrs. Bennet was alone , than she likewise began on the subject , calling on Miss Lucas for her compassion , and entreating her to persuade her friend Lizzy to comply with the wishes of her family .

text: “ Pray do , my dear Miss Lucas , ” she added , in a melancholy tone ; “ for nobody is on my side , nobody takes part with me ; I am cruelly used , nobody feels for my poor nerves . ”
text_tokenized: “ Pray do , my dear Miss Lucas , ” she added , in a melancholy tone ; “ for nobody is on my side , nobody takes part with me ; I am cruelly used , nobody feels for my poor nerves . ”

text: Charlotte ’s reply was spared by the entrance of Jane and Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: Charlotte ’s reply was spared by the entrance of Jane and Elizabeth .

text: “ Ay , there she comes , ” continued Mrs. Bennet , “ looking as unconcerned as may be , and caring no more for us than if we were at York , provided she can have her own way .
text_tokenized: “ Ay , there she comes , ” continued Mrs. Bennet , “ looking as unconcerned as may be , and caring no more for us than if we were at York , provided she can have her own way .

text: But I tell you what , Miss Lizzy , if you take it into your head to go on refusing every offer of marriage in this way , you will never get a husband at all -- and I am sure I do not know who is to maintain you when your father is dead .
text_tokenized: But I tell you what , Miss Lizzy , if you take it into your head to go on refusing every offer of marriage in this way , you will never get a husband at all -- and I am sure I do not know who is to maintain you when your father is dead .

text: _ I _ shall not be able to keep you -- and so I warn you .
text_tokenized: _ I _ shall not be able to keep you -- and so I warn you .

text: I have done with you from this very day .
text_tokenized: I have done with you from this very day .

text: I told you in the library , you know , that I should never speak to you again , and you will find me as good as my word .
text_tokenized: I told you in the library , you know , that I should never speak to you again , and you will find me as good as my word .

text: I have no pleasure in talking to undutiful children .
text_tokenized: I have no pleasure in talking to undutiful children .

text: Not that I have much pleasure , indeed , in talking to anybody .
text_tokenized: Not that I have much pleasure , indeed , in talking to anybody .

text: People who suffer as I do from nervous complaints can have no great inclination for talking .
text_tokenized: People who suffer as I do from nervous complaints can have no great inclination for talking .

text: Nobody can tell what I suffer !
text_tokenized: Nobody can tell what I suffer !

text: But it is always so .
text_tokenized: But it is always so .

text: Those who do not complain are never pitied .
text_tokenized: Those who do not complain are never pitied .

text: Her daughters listened in silence to this effusion , sensible that any attempt to reason with or soothe her would only increase the irritation .
text_tokenized: Her daughters listened in silence to this effusion , sensible that any attempt to reason with or soothe her would only increase the irritation .

text: She talked on , therefore , without interruption from any of them till they were joined by Mr. Collins , who entered with an air more stately than usual , and on perceiving whom , she said to the girls,-- “ Now , I do insist upon it , that you , all of you , hold your tongues , and let Mr. Collins and me have a little conversation together .
text_tokenized: She talked on , therefore , without interruption from any of them till they were joined by Mr. Collins , who entered with an air more stately than usual , and on perceiving whom , she said to the girls,-- “ Now , I do insist upon it , that you , all of you , hold your tongues , and let Mr. Collins and me have a little conversation together .

text: Elizabeth passed quietly out of the room , Jane and Kitty followed , but Lydia stood her ground , determined to hear all she could ; and
text_tokenized: Elizabeth passed quietly out of the room , Jane and Kitty followed , but Lydia stood her ground , determined to hear all she could ; and

text: Charlotte , detained first by the civility of Mr. Collins , whose inquiries after herself and all her family were very minute , and then by a little curiosity , satisfied herself with walking to the window and pretending not to hear .
text_tokenized: Charlotte , detained first by the civility of Mr. Collins , whose inquiries after herself and all her family were very minute , and then by a little curiosity , satisfied herself with walking to the window and pretending not to hear .

text: In a doleful voice Mrs. Bennet thus began the projected conversation:-- “ Oh , Mr. Collins ! ”
text_tokenized: In a doleful voice Mrs. Bennet thus began the projected conversation:-- “ Oh , Mr. Collins ! ”

text: “ My dear madam , ” replied he , “ let us be for ever silent on this point .
text_tokenized: “ My dear madam , ” replied he , “ let us be for ever silent on this point .

text: Far be it from me , ” he presently continued , in a voice that marked his displeasure , “ to resent the behaviour of your daughter .
text_tokenized: Far be it from me , ” he presently continued , in a voice that marked his displeasure , “ to resent the behaviour of your daughter .

text: Resignation to inevitable evils is the duty of us all : the peculiar duty of a young man who has been so fortunate as I have been , in early preferment ; and , I trust , I am resigned .
text_tokenized: Resignation to inevitable evils is the duty of us all : the peculiar duty of a young man who has been so fortunate as I have been , in early preferment ; and , I trust , I am resigned .

text: Perhaps not the less so from feeling a doubt of my positive happiness had my fair cousin honoured me with her hand ; for I have often observed , that resignation is never so perfect as when the blessing denied begins to lose somewhat of its value in our estimation .
text_tokenized: Perhaps not the less so from feeling a doubt of my positive happiness had my fair cousin honoured me with her hand ; for I have often observed , that resignation is never so perfect as when the blessing denied begins to lose somewhat of its value in our estimation .

text: You will not , I hope , consider me as showing any disrespect to your family , my dear madam , by thus withdrawing my pretensions to your daughter ’s favour , without having paid yourself and Mr. Bennet the compliment of requesting you to interpose your authority in my behalf .
text_tokenized: You will not , I hope , consider me as showing any disrespect to your family , my dear madam , by thus withdrawing my pretensions to your daughter ’s favour , without having paid yourself and Mr. Bennet the compliment of requesting you to interpose your authority in my behalf .

text: My conduct may , I fear , be objectionable in having accepted my dismission from your daughter ’s lips instead of your own ; but we are all liable to error .
text_tokenized: My conduct may , I fear , be objectionable in having accepted my dismission from your daughter ’s lips instead of your own ; but we are all liable to error .

text: I have certainly meant well through the whole affair .
text_tokenized: I have certainly meant well through the whole affair .

text: My object has been to secure an amiable companion for myself , with due consideration for the advantage of all your family ; and if my _ manner _ has been at all reprehensible , I here beg leave to apologize . ”
text_tokenized: My object has been to secure an amiable companion for myself , with due consideration for the advantage of all your family ; and if my _ manner _ has been at all reprehensible , I here beg leave to apologize . ”

text: XXI .
text_tokenized: XXI .

text: The discussion of Mr. Collins ’s offer was now nearly at an end , and Elizabeth had only to suffer from the uncomfortable feelings necessarily attending it , and occasionally from some peevish allusion of her mother .
text_tokenized: The discussion of Mr. Collins ’s offer was now nearly at an end , and Elizabeth had only to suffer from the uncomfortable feelings necessarily attending it , and occasionally from some peevish allusion of her mother .

text: As for the gentleman himself , _ his _ feelings were chiefly expressed , not by embarrassment or dejection , or by trying to avoid her , but by stiffness of manner and resentful silence .
text_tokenized: As for the gentleman himself , _ his _ feelings were chiefly expressed , not by embarrassment or dejection , or by trying to avoid her , but by stiffness of manner and resentful silence .

text: He scarcely ever spoke to her ; and the assiduous attentions which he had been so sensible of himself were transferred for the rest of the day to Miss Lucas , whose civility in listening to him was a seasonable relief to them all , and especially to her friend .

text: The morrow produced no abatement of Mrs. Bennet ’s ill humour or ill health .
text_tokenized: The morrow produced no abatement of Mrs. Bennet ’s ill humour or ill health .

text: Mr. Collins was also in the same state of angry pride .

text_tokenized: Elizabeth had hoped that his resentment might shorten his visit , but his plan did not appear in the least affected by it .

text: He was always to have gone on Saturday , and to Saturday he still meant to stay .

text: After breakfast , the girls walked to Meryton , to inquire if Mr. Wickham were returned , and to lament over his absence from the Netherfield ball .

text: “ I found , ” said he , “ as the time drew near , that I had better not meet Mr. Darcy;--that to be in the same room , the same party with him for so many hours together , might be more than I could bear , and that scenes might arise unpleasant to more than myself .

text: The next was in these words:--“‘I do not pretend to regret anything I shall leave in Hertfordshire except your society , my dearest friend ; but we will hope , at some future period , to enjoy many returns of that delightful intercourse we have known , and in the meanwhile may lessen the pain of separation by a very frequent and most unreserved correspondence .
text_tokenized: The next was in these words:--“‘I do not pretend to regret anything I shall leave in Hertfordshire except your society , my dearest friend ; but we will hope , at some future period , to enjoy many returns of that delightful intercourse we have known , and in the meanwhile may lessen the pain of separation by a very frequent and most unreserved correspondence .

text: I depend on you for that . ’ ”
text_tokenized: I depend on you for that . ’ ”

text: To these high - flown expressions
text_tokenized: To these high - flown expressions

text: Elizabeth listened with all the insensibility of distrust ; and though the suddenness of their removal surprised her , she saw nothing in it really to lament : it was not to be supposed that their absence from Netherfield would prevent Mr. Bingley ’s being there ; and as to the loss of their society , she was persuaded that Jane must soon cease to regard it in the enjoyment of his . “ It is unlucky , ” said she , after a short pause , “ that you should not be able to see your friends before they leave the country .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth listened with all the insensibility of distrust ; and though the suddenness of their removal surprised her , she saw nothing in it really to lament : it was not to be supposed that their absence from Netherfield would prevent Mr. Bingley ’s being there ; and as to the loss of their society , she was persuaded that Jane must soon cease to regard it in the enjoyment of his . “ It is unlucky , ” said she , after a short pause , “ that you should not be able to see your friends before they leave the country .

text: But may we not hope that the period of future happiness , to which Miss Bingley looks forward , may arrive earlier than she is aware , and that the delightful intercourse you have known as friends will be renewed with yet greater satisfaction as sisters ?
text_tokenized: But may we not hope that the period of future happiness , to which Miss Bingley looks forward , may arrive earlier than she is aware , and that the delightful intercourse you have known as friends will be renewed with yet greater satisfaction as sisters ?

text: Mr. Bingley will not be detained in London by them . ”
text_tokenized: Mr. Bingley will not be detained in London by them . ”

text: “ Caroline decidedly says that none of the party will return into Hertfordshire this winter .
text_tokenized: “ Caroline decidedly says that none of the party will return into Hertfordshire this winter .

text: I will read it to you .
text_tokenized: I will read it to you .

text: “ ‘ When my brother left us yesterday , he imagined that the business which took him to London might be concluded in three or four days ; but as we are certain it can not be so , and at the same time convinced that when Charles gets to town he will be in no hurry to leave it again , we have determined on following him thither , that he may not be obliged to spend his vacant hours in a comfortless hotel .
text_tokenized: “ ‘ When my brother left us yesterday , he imagined that the business which took him to London might be concluded in three or four days ; but as we are certain it can not be so , and at the same time convinced that when Charles gets to town he will be in no hurry to leave it again , we have determined on following him thither , that he may not be obliged to spend his vacant hours in a comfortless hotel .

text: Many of my acquaintance are already there for the winter : I wish I could hear that you , my dearest friend , had any intention of making one in the crowd , but of that I despair .
text_tokenized: Many of my acquaintance are already there for the winter : I wish I could hear that you , my dearest friend , had any intention of making one in the crowd , but of that I despair .

text: I sincerely hope your Christmas in Hertfordshire may abound in the gaieties which that season generally brings , and that your beaux will be so numerous as to prevent your feeling the loss of the three of whom we shall deprive you .
text_tokenized: I sincerely hope your Christmas in Hertfordshire may abound in the gaieties which that season generally brings , and that your beaux will be so numerous as to prevent your feeling the loss of the three of whom we shall deprive you .

text: “ It is evident by this , ” added Jane , “ that he comes back no more this winter . ” “ It is only evident that Miss Bingley does not mean he _ should _ . ” “ Why will you think so ?
text_tokenized: “ It is evident by this , ” added Jane , “ that he comes back no more this winter . ” “ It is only evident that Miss Bingley does not mean he _ should _ . ” “ Why will you think so ?

text: It must be his own doing ; he is his own master .
text_tokenized: It must be his own doing ; he is his own master .

text_tokenized: But you do not know _ all _ .

text: I _ will _ read you the passage which particularly hurts me .
text_tokenized: I _ will _ read you the passage which particularly hurts me .

text: I will have no reserves from _ you _ .
text_tokenized: I will have no reserves from _ you _ .

text: ‘ Mr. Darcy is impatient to see his sister ; and to confess the truth , _ we _ are scarcely less eager to meet her again .
text_tokenized: ‘ Mr. Darcy is impatient to see his sister ; and to confess the truth , _ we _ are scarcely less eager to meet her again .

text: I really do not think Georgiana Darcy has her equal for beauty , elegance , and accomplishments ; and the affection she inspires in Louisa and myself is heightened into something still more interesting from the hope we dare to entertain of her being hereafter our sister .
text_tokenized: I really do not think Georgiana Darcy has her equal for beauty , elegance , and accomplishments ; and the affection she inspires in Louisa and myself is heightened into something still more interesting from the hope we dare to entertain of her being hereafter our sister .

text: I do not know whether I ever before mentioned to you my feelings on this subject , but I will not leave the country without confiding them , and I trust you will not esteem them unreasonable .
text_tokenized: I do not know whether I ever before mentioned to you my feelings on this subject , but I will not leave the country without confiding them , and I trust you will not esteem them unreasonable .

text: My brother admires her greatly already ; he will have frequent opportunity now of seeing her on the most intimate footing ; her relations all wish the connection as much as his own ; and a sister ’s partiality is not misleading me , I think , when I call Charles most capable of engaging any woman ’s heart .
text_tokenized: My brother admires her greatly already ; he will have frequent opportunity now of seeing her on the most intimate footing ; her relations all wish the connection as much as his own ; and a sister ’s partiality is not misleading me , I think , when I call Charles most capable of engaging any woman ’s heart .

text: With all these circumstances to favour an attachment , and nothing to prevent it , am I wrong , my dearest Jane , in indulging the hope of an event which will secure the happiness of so many ? ’
text_tokenized: With all these circumstances to favour an attachment , and nothing to prevent it , am I wrong , my dearest Jane , in indulging the hope of an event which will secure the happiness of so many ? ’

text: What think you of _ this _ sentence , my dear Lizzy ? ” said Jane , as she finished it .
text_tokenized: What think you of _ this _ sentence , my dear Lizzy ? ” said Jane , as she finished it .

text: “ Is it not clear enough ?
text_tokenized: “ Is it not clear enough ?

text: Does it not expressly declare that Caroline neither expects nor wishes me to be her sister ; that she is perfectly convinced of her brother ’s indifference ; and that if she suspects the nature of my feelings for him she means ( most kindly ! ) to put me on my guard .
text_tokenized: Does it not expressly declare that Caroline neither expects nor wishes me to be her sister ; that she is perfectly convinced of her brother ’s indifference ; and that if she suspects the nature of my feelings for him she means ( most kindly ! ) to put me on my guard .

text: Can there be any other opinion on the subject ?
text_tokenized: Can there be any other opinion on the subject ?

text: “ Yes , there can ; for mine is totally different .
text_tokenized: “ Yes , there can ; for mine is totally different .

text: Will you hear it ? ” “ Most willingly . ”
text_tokenized: Will you hear it ? ” “ Most willingly . ”

text: “ You shall have it in a few words .
text_tokenized: “ You shall have it in a few words .

text: Miss Bingley sees that her brother is in love with you and wants him to marry Miss Darcy .
text_tokenized: Miss Bingley sees that her brother is in love with you and wants him to marry Miss Darcy .

text: She follows him to town in the hope of keeping him there , and tries to persuade you that he does not care about you . ”
text_tokenized: She follows him to town in the hope of keeping him there , and tries to persuade you that he does not care about you . ”

text: Jane shook her head .
text_tokenized: Jane shook her head .

text: “ Indeed , Jane , you ought to believe me .
text_tokenized: “ Indeed , Jane , you ought to believe me .

text: No one who has ever seen you together
text_tokenized: No one who has ever seen you together

text: can doubt his affection ; Miss Bingley , I am sure , can not : she is not such a simpleton .
text_tokenized: can doubt his affection ; Miss Bingley , I am sure , can not : she is not such a simpleton .

text: Could she have seen half as much love in Mr. Darcy for herself , she would have ordered her wedding clothes .
text_tokenized: Could she have seen half as much love in Mr. Darcy for herself , she would have ordered her wedding clothes .

text: But the case is this:--we are not rich enough or grand enough for them ; and she is the more anxious to get Miss Darcy for her brother , from the notion that when there has been _ one _ inter - marriage , she may have less trouble in achieving a second ; in which there is certainly some ingenuity , and I dare say it would succeed if Miss de Bourgh were out of the way .
text_tokenized: But the case is this:--we are not rich enough or grand enough for them ; and she is the more anxious to get Miss Darcy for her brother , from the notion that when there has been _ one _ inter - marriage , she may have less trouble in achieving a second ; in which there is certainly some ingenuity , and I dare say it would succeed if Miss de Bourgh were out of the way .

text: But , my dearest Jane , you can not seriously imagine that , because Miss Bingley tells you her brother greatly admires Miss Darcy , he is in the smallest degree less sensible of _ your _ merit than when he took leave of you on Tuesday ; or that it will be in her power to persuade him that , instead of being in love with you , he is very much in love with her friend . ”
text_tokenized: But , my dearest Jane , you can not seriously imagine that , because Miss Bingley tells you her brother greatly admires Miss Darcy , he is in the smallest degree less sensible of _ your _ merit than when he took leave of you on Tuesday ; or that it will be in her power to persuade him that , instead of being in love with you , he is very much in love with her friend . ”

text: “ If we thought alike of Miss Bingley , ” replied Jane , “ your representation of all this might make me quite easy .
text_tokenized: “ If we thought alike of Miss Bingley , ” replied Jane , “ your representation of all this might make me quite easy .

text: But I know the foundation is unjust .
text_tokenized: But I know the foundation is unjust .

text: Caroline is incapable of wilfully deceiving anyone ; and all that I can hope in this case is , that she is deceived herself . ” “ That is right .
text_tokenized: Caroline is incapable of wilfully deceiving anyone ; and all that I can hope in this case is , that she is deceived herself . ” “ That is right .

text: You could not have started a more happy idea , since you will not take comfort in mine : believe her to be deceived , by all means .
text_tokenized: You could not have started a more happy idea , since you will not take comfort in mine : believe her to be deceived , by all means .

text: You have now done your duty by her , and must fret no longer . ”
text_tokenized: You have now done your duty by her , and must fret no longer . ”

text: “ But , my dear sister , can I be happy , even supposing the best , in accepting a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere ? ” “ You must decide for yourself , ” said Elizabeth ; “ and if , upon mature deliberation , you find that the misery of disobliging his two sisters is more than equivalent to the happiness of being his wife , I advise you , by all means , to refuse him . ” “ How can you talk so ? ” said Jane , faintly smiling ; “ you must know , that , though I should be exceedingly grieved at their disapprobation , I could not hesitate . ” “ I did not think you would ; and that being the case , I can not consider your situation with much compassion . ” “ But if he returns no more this winter , my choice will never be required .
text_tokenized: “ But , my dear sister , can I be happy , even supposing the best , in accepting a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere ? ” “ You must decide for yourself , ” said Elizabeth ; “ and if , upon mature deliberation , you find that the misery of disobliging his two sisters is more than equivalent to the happiness of being his wife , I advise you , by all means , to refuse him . ” “ How can you talk so ? ” said Jane , faintly smiling ; “ you must know , that , though I should be exceedingly grieved at their disapprobation , I could not hesitate . ” “ I did not think you would ; and that being the case , I can not consider your situation with much compassion . ” “ But if he returns no more this winter , my choice will never be required .

text: A thousand things may arise in six months . ”
text_tokenized: A thousand things may arise in six months . ”

text: The idea of his returning no more Elizabeth treated with the utmost contempt .
text_tokenized: The idea of his returning no more Elizabeth treated with the utmost contempt .

text: It appeared to her merely the suggestion of Caroline ’s interested wishes ; and she could not for a moment suppose that those wishes , however openly or artfully spoken , could influence a young man so totally independent of everyone .
text_tokenized: It appeared to her merely the suggestion of Caroline ’s interested wishes ; and she could not for a moment suppose that those wishes , however openly or artfully spoken , could influence a young man so totally independent of everyone .

text: She represented to her sister , as forcibly as possible , what she felt on the subject , and had soon the pleasure of seeing its happy effect . Jane ’s temper was not desponding ; and she was gradually led to hope , though the diffidence of affection sometimes overcame the hope , that Bingley would return to Netherfield , and answer every wish of her heart .

Jane ’s temper was not desponding ; and she was gradually led to hope , though the diffidence of affection sometimes overcame the hope , that Bingley would return to Netherfield , and answer every wish of her heart .

text: They agreed that Mrs. Bennet should only hear of the departure of the family , without being alarmed on the score of the gentleman ’s conduct ; but even this partial communication gave her a great deal of concern ,
text_tokenized: They agreed that Mrs. Bennet should only hear of the departure of the family , without being alarmed on the score of the gentleman ’s conduct ; but even this partial communication gave her a great deal of concern ,

text: and she bewailed it as exceedingly unlucky that the ladies should happen to go away just as they were all getting so intimate together .
text_tokenized: and she bewailed it as exceedingly unlucky that the ladies should happen to go away just as they were all getting so intimate together .

text: After lamenting it , however , at some length , she had the consolation of thinking that Mr. Bingley would be soon down again , and soon dining at Longbourn ; and the conclusion of all was the comfortable declaration , that , though he had been invited only to a family dinner , she would take care to have two full courses .
text_tokenized: After lamenting it , however , at some length , she had the consolation of thinking that Mr. Bingley would be soon down again , and soon dining at Longbourn ; and the conclusion of all was the comfortable declaration , that , though he had been invited only to a family dinner , she would take care to have two full courses .
